message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which we believe would greatly benefit your business. Considering its value to you, I propose an initial price of $1200000. This is a special offer considering the high demand and unique features of this product.

Thank you for your offer, Alice.  While I appreciate the value of this product, $1200000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with at this time. I'd be willing to pay $950000. This represents a fair price for both of us, allowing me to acquire the product while still leaving room for you to make a profit.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and would like to make a counteroffer. Considering the value of the product to you and our ongoing negotiation, I propose a price of $1050000. This allows for a reasonable profit margin while still being competitive.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1050000 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $975000.  This offer represents a fair middle ground and allows us both to make a mutually beneficial deal.

I appreciate your continued interest, Bob. After careful consideration, I am willing to lower the price to $1025000. This still maintains a good profit margin for me while offering you a fair price for the product. I hope this proposal works for you.

Alice, I see we're getting closer.  While I appreciate your willingness to come down,  $1025000 is still a bit high.  I'm willing to go up to $1000000.  This is my final offer. If we can't agree on this price, I'll have to consider other options, including buying from John.

Thank you for your final offer, Bob. I appreciate your persistence and I'm willing to meet you halfway at $987500. I believe this offers a fair compromise between maintaining a good profit margin for me and providing you with a competitive price for the product.
